page.title: 08ECOLOGY-STREAM SURVEY.
page.content: On Tuesday 4/6/85,Class 4 visited a local stream as part of our Domesday project. It was a sunnyday.The stream was about 2M. wide,the water was a bit muddy and was flowing quite fast. We timed how long it took for a tennis ball, a ping pong ball, and an empty jam jar to float a distance of 10, metres in the stream. We measured a profile of the width of the stream by measuring how deep it was at 20cm intervals. At its deepest, it was only 50cm. There were many different plants. Pink Campion, Lady smock, Willow Herb, reeds and trees like Willow and Alder. Sticklebacks were in the stream and swallows swooping down to scoop up a drink. Judith Plant.Age 9.
